intro: Grindelia howellii, commonly known as Howell's gumweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its grayish-green, fuzzy leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal areas. It produces small, wind-pollinated flowers that develop into capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Grindelia howellii is adapted to arid environments and has a long flowering period, usually from late spring to early fall.
